description: The smallest of the macaw species, Hahn's Macaws are compact, primarily green parrots with a patch of red on the bend of their wings. They are part of the 'mini-macaw' group.
temperament: Have a classic 'big macaw' personality in a small body. They are intelligent, playful, and can be very affectionate, but are also known for being feisty and nippy if not well-trained.
loudness: Loud. Their call is a high-pitched screech, but it is not as deafening as that of their larger cousins.
vocalization: Fairly good talkers. They can learn a decent vocabulary and their voices are higher-pitched than larger macaws.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet of high-quality pellets, fresh vegetables, some fruit, and a limited amount of nuts.
healthPointers: A hardy species that can live 20-30 years. Still susceptible to common psittacine diseases. Can become cage-aggressive if not handled regularly.
housing: A roomy cage is still necessary. Minimum size of 24"W x 24"D x 36"H. Can be suitable for apartments if the owner can tolerate their noise level.
